intro: Tylophora perrottetiana, commonly known as the Chinese star vine, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are often clustered in umbels, followed by follicle fruits containing seeds with tufted pappus. It is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
